page.title: 03Historic Buildings
page.content: There is a great wealth of historic buildings in the area, in addition to the churches and the village has been designated as a Conservation Area. This means that all the buildings of historic importance will be retained and improved. Any new buildings will have to be constructed of materials appropriate to the neighbourhood. Every effort will be made to retain all existing hedgerows and trees. All the cast iron hydrants in the village will be preserved. There are a total of 43 buildings in the village that have been listed as being of importance by the Department of Environment. In addition to these many others are considered to be important buildings and this includes the Baptist Chapel and the Lower School.
